segments.text: I'm looking at that boy on the stool, and it's making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool itself looks incredibly unstable; its legs are splayed out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching so far, reaching into that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see it tilting backward, just slightly, but enough to worry me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A fall from that height could really cause some serious injury.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I imagine the crash, the broken plate, the cookies scattered everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sad to think of him getting hurt just for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl doesn't seem to notice the danger, only the prize.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would stabilize that stool or tell him to get down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman, of course, is completely lost in her dish drying task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like an accident is just moments away from happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart sinks a little seeing such avoidable risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Poor children, they just don't understand the dangers around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope he manages to get down safely, cookies or not.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just ripe for an unfortunate incident.
segments.speaker: PAR
